channel.title: PC connected to lan without internet?
channel.description:
Alright so I've been trying to get this pc on my network working. I plug the ethernet cable in, it connects to the network fine, I can connect to the routers interface etc. I have other pcs on the network connected to the same router via ethernet and they all work fine, but they're all running either Vista or 7. This computer is running XP, and I never remember having to set certain settings, I thought it was always plug and go.
The wireless network that the same router broadcasts is encrypted, but the ethernet network shouldn't have to authenticate right? I didn't have to on the other pcs..
So here it is; computer recognizes router, router recognizes pc, other computers, get internet off it, but this computer doesn't.
What can I do? :l

item.title: PC connected to lan without internet?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Just set your own settings, copy the DNS from one of the other computers it could be 192.168.1.1 or 192.168.2.1 it depends and then find an ip address no in use check your router you can use a higher number like 15, 20, 25, 30 it just depends on how many devices are hooked up, then just use the default gateway off on of the other computers and you should be fine. The default gateway should be the same as the DNS address.

Read full topic
item.source: PC connected to lan without internet?

item.title: PC connected to lan without internet?
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:14, topic:347447”]avast pro for real-time protection and malwarebytes’ anti-malware for system scans

i was infected the other day quite harshly with a dns trojan; it basically got into my registry and changed all dns entries, so almost every time i would access a site, it would redirect me to an advertisement (even google)

avast didn’t detect shit (which i found quite odd), so i found malwarebytes’ anti-virus and it completely removed trojan and cleaned my registry[/quote]Fuck I have that now. Brb malewarebytes’

Read full topic
item.source: PC connected to lan without internet?

item.title: PC connected to lan without internet?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

BloodRayne:

The computer had Norton installed. I didn’t realize. And guess what? It blocked my router… I had to add an exception for 192.168.1.1, which I thought is the most universal router address, yet it had it blocked. I swear when I realized it was blocking it I fucking raged, this just strengthened my everlasting hate for Norton.

Its not really a “router address” - 192.168.1.* is just a range that is guaranteed to never need to route outside the LAN. There could be anything there and the ability to block it is important… lol at doing it accidentally though, Norton ftl

Read full topic
item.source: PC connected to lan without internet?

item.title: PC connected to lan without internet?
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Both ping and nslookup hang, they don’t return any results.

Internet connection settings say the DNS is automatically configured :l

http://support.microsoft.com/kb/811259 <-- tried that, didn’t work >.<

Read full topic
item.source: PC connected to lan without internet?

item.title: PC connected to lan without internet?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Start with the most basic thing. Do you have connectivity to the other computers on the network? ping them. Ping a website to see if you are connected, if you are you probably don’t have DNS setup correctly. type ‘nslookup moparisthebest.com’ in the terminal and see if anything comes back.

Do that and get back to us.

Read full topic
